tit.cmt: この用語の語源が後述されていますが、両単語は異なる漢字で表記されるのに、発音が同じなので、両者が異なる語であることが分かるよう、漢字も併記しています。用語集の訳語のカッコ内説明は、後述の「書院番」等の訳語表記に合わせ、頭文字は小文字にして、複数形で表記しています。

sen.j: 小十人（こじゅうにん）は、江戸幕府における警備・軍事部門（番方）の役職のひとつである。
sen.e: The term "Kojunin" refers to a post of the security and military division (Bankata [security officials]) of the Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun).
sen.cmt: 警備・軍事部門: 定訳不明/番方: 用語集の訳語に説明がないため、「http://kotobank.jp/word/%E7%95%AA%E6%96%B9」を基に説明を補足していますが、これは定訳ではありません。
sen.e: The term "Kojunin" refers to a post of the security and military division (Bankata [security officials]) of the Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun).
The term "Kojunin" refers to a post of the security and military division (Bankata [security officials]) of the Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun).

sen.j: 語源は扈従人であるとされる。
sen.e: The term is said to have come from Kojunin (扈従人) (an attendant).
sen.cmt: 扈従人: 用語集の訳語に説明がないため、「http://kotobank.jp/word/%E6%89%88%E5%BE%93」「http://tangorin.com/words/扈従」に基づく説明を補っていますが、これは定訳ではありません。
sen.e: The term is said to have come from Kojunin (an attendant).
sen.cmt: 漢字は不要のため削除しました。
sen.e: The term is said to have come from Kojunin (an attendant).

sen.j: 将軍及びその嫡男を護衛する歩兵を中心とした親衛隊である。
sen.e: Kojunin were bodyguards in which foot soldiers guarding a shogun and his legitimate sons played a central role.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Kojunin were bodyguards most of whom were foot soldiers gurading a shogun and his legitimate sons.
sen.cmt: 原文に即した訳にするため変更しました。 in which foot soldiers guarding a shogun and his legitimate sons played a central role.→most of whom were foot soldiers gurading a shogun and his legitimate sons.
sen.e: Kojunin were bodyguards most of whom were foot soldiers gurading a shogun and his legitimate sons.

sen.j: 行軍・行列の前衛部隊、目的地の先遣警備隊、城中警備係の3つの役目がある。
sen.e: Their duties were divided into three categories, i. e. the vanguard on a march or in a procession, Senkenkeibitai (advance) to be sent to a destination, and the security guard inside a castle.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処/先遣警備隊: 6/25の用語メールでご連絡しました通り、「先遣部隊(軍事用語)」という意味がある「advance」(英辞郎 on the Web)にしました。
sen.e: Their duties were divided into three categories, i. e. the vanguard on a march or in a procession, Senkenkeibitai (advance army) to be sent to a destination, and the security guard inside a castle.
sen.cmt: advanceのみでは意味がはっきりしないため、advance armyとしました。
sen.e: Their duties were divided into three categories, i. e. the vanguard on a march or in a procession, Senkenkeibitai (advance army) to be sent to a destination, and the security guard inside a castle.

sen.j: 小十人の役職名は、江戸幕府と諸藩（特に大きな藩）に見ることができる。
sen.e: The title "Kojunin" can be found in documents on the Edo bakufu or domains, especially large domains.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The title "Kojunin" can be found in documents on the Edo bakufu or domains, especially large domains.

sen.j: 将軍（あるいは藩主）及び嫡子の護衛・警備を役目とする。
sen.e: The function of Kojunin was to guard and defend a shogun (or a domain lord) and his legitimate sons.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The function of Kojunin was to guard and defend a shogun (or a domain lord) and his legitimate sons.

sen.j: 歩兵が主力である。
sen.e: Foot soldiers played a central role in it.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Foot soldiers played a central role in it.
Foot soldiers played a central role in it.

sen.j: 戦時・行軍においては主君に最も近い位置にいる歩兵である.
sen.e: They were the foot soldiers who were closest to their lord in wartime or on a march.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: They were the foot soldiers who were closest to their lord in wartime or on a march.

sen.j: (その)ため、歩兵でも比較的格式が高い。
sen.e: Therefore, those who held this post had a relatively high social status among foot soldiers.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処(文分割で不完全な文になったため、文頭のカッコ内に必要な語句を補っています)
sen.e: Therefore, those who held this post had a relatively high social status among foot soldiers.

sen.j: 江戸幕府においては五番方（新番・小十人・小姓番・書院番・大番）のひとつとされる。
sen.e: It was a part of Gobankata (literally, "five Bankata") consisting of Shinban (new guards), Kojunin, Koshoban (inner guards), Shoinban (castle guards) and Oban (a group of guards in the Edo bakufu) in the Edo bakufu.
sen.cmt: 五番方: 用語集の訳語に説明がないため、カッコ内に説明を補っていますが、これは定訳ではありません。/新番: 用語集の訳語を、他の訳語に合わせた表記にしています。/小姓番: 定訳不明。将軍の殿中における警護を行う職制を指すため(「http://kotobank.jp/word/%E5%B0%8F%E5%A7%93」の「小姓組番」)、「http://www.scribd.com/doc/32385737/Samurai-Armies-1467-1649」のP95の「Koshoban(inner guard)」を使用し、他の職制の訳に合わせて複数形にしています。/書院番: 用語集の訳語のカッコ内説明は、他の訳語に合わせ、定冠詞を削除しています。/大番: 用語集の訳語の初出の説明の「Edo shogunate」は「Edo bakufu」に直しています。
sen.e: It was a part of Gobankata (literally, "five Bankata") consisting of Shinban (new guards), Kojunin, Koshoban (inner guards), Shoinban (castle guards) and Oban (a group of guards in the Edo bakufu) in the Edo bakufu.

It was a part of Gobankata (literally, "five Bankata") consisting of Shinban (new guards), Kojunin, Koshoban (inner guards), Shoinban (castle guards) and Oban (a group of guards in the Edo bakufu) in the Edo bakufu.

sen.j: 平時にあっては江戸城檜之間に詰め、警備の一翼を担った。
sen.e: Those who held this post were on duty in Hinoki no ma (a Japanese cypress room) of Edo-jo Castle in time of peace to play a role in guarding.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処/檜之間: 用語統一リストに従い、用語集の訳語からハイフンを削除しました。
sen.e: Those who held this post were on duty in Hinoki no ma (a Japanese cypress room) of Edo-jo Castle in time of peace to guard the castle.
sen.cmt: より自然な流れにするため変更しました。To play a role in guarding→to guard the castle.
sen.e: Those who held this post were on duty in Hinoki no ma (a Japanese cypress room) of Edo-jo Castle in time of peace to guard the castle.

sen.j: 泰平の世にあっては将軍が日光東照宮、増上寺、寛永寺などに参拝のため、江戸城を外出するときが腕の見せ所であった。
sen.e: When a shogun went out of Edo-jo Castle to visit Nikko Tosho-gu Shrine, Zojo-ji Temple, Kanei-ji Temple, etc. in time of peace, it was the time to show their stuff.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処/泰平の世: 用語集の訳語は文脈に合わないため、別の訳出をしています。
sen.e: When a shogun went out of Edo-jo Castle to visit Nikko Tosho-gu Shrine, Zojo-ji Temple, Kanei-ji Temple, etc. in time of peace, it was the time to show their stuff.
When a shogun went out of Edo-jo Castle to visit Nikko Tosho-gu Shrine, Zojo-ji Temple, Kanei-ji Temple, etc. in time of peace, it was the time to show their stuff.

sen.j: 繁忙期であった。
sen.e: They were busy on such an occasion.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: They were busy on such occasions.
sen.cmt: この場合occasionは複数の方が適切だと思います。
sen.e: They were busy on such occasions.

sen.j: 将軍外出時には将軍行列の前衛の歩兵を勤めたり、将軍の目的地に先遣隊として乗り込んでその一帯を警備した。
sen.e: When a shogun went out, they served as advance foot soldiers in a shogun's procession or went ahead of him toward his destination as the advance to guard the area.
sen.cmt: 将軍行列: 定訳不明/前衛の歩兵: 定訳不明。「前衛部隊」の訳語「advance guard(軍事)」(英辞郎 on the Web)からの類推です。
sen.e: When a shogun went out, they served as advance foot soldiers in a shogun's procession or went ahead of him toward his destination as the advance to guard the area.

sen.j: 江戸時代初期や幕末には小十人が将軍とともに京都・大阪に赴いた。
sen.e: Kojunin attended a shogun on a trip to Kyoto and Osaka in the beginning and the end of Edo period
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Kojunin accompanied a shogun on a trip to Kyoto and Osaka in the beginning and the end of Edo period
sen.cmt: attendよりacompanyの方が自然のため変更しました。

sen.j: 二条城等の警護にも当たっている。
sen.e: They also guarded Nijo-jo Castle, etc.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処/二条城: 2つの訳語が登録されていますが、指示書に沿った訳語を使用しています。
sen.e: They also guarded Nijo-jo Castle, etc.
They also guarded Nijo-jo Castle, etc.

sen.j: 小十人のトップは、小十人頭（あるいは小十人番頭）であった。
sen.e: Kojunin were headed by Kojunin gashira (the head of Kojunin) or Kojunin banto (a general manager of escort guards).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処/小十人頭: 定訳不明。読み方は「http://www.aozora.gr.jp/cards/001224/files/46127_29165.html」等によります。/小十人番頭: 用語集の訳語のカッコ内の説明は、本文の「小十人」の訳語表記に合わせています。
sen.e: Kojunin were headed by Kojunin gashira (the head of Kojunin) or Kojunin banto (a general manager of escort guards).
Kojunin were headed by Kojunin gashira (the head of Kojunin) or Kojunin banto (a general manager of escort guards).

sen.j: 主に1,000石以上の旗本寄合席から選ばれた（足高の制による役高は1,000石）。
sen.e: Kojunin gashira and Kojunin banto were basically selected from those belonging to hatamoto yoriaiseki (a family rank of high-ranking hatamoto, direct vassal of the shogun) whose annual stipend assessed on the basis of a crop was 1,000 koku (of rice) (a unit of volume: rice 1-koku is 180.39 liter, lumber 1-koku is 0.278 cubic meter) or over (Their yakudaka [salary paid in accordance with the rank of one's post] based on tashidaka system [a wage system established by the Edo bakufu] was 1,000 koku.).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処/1,000石以上: 「石」は「http://tangorin.com/words/石高」の2.に基づき訳しています。/足高の制: 「足高制」として登録されている訳語の一部を修正して(Edo bakufu -> the Edo bakufu)使用しています。
sen.e: Kojunin gashira and Kojunin banto were basically selected from those belonging to hatamoto yoriaiseki (a family rank of high-ranking hatamoto, direct vassal of the shogun) whose annual stipend assessed on the basis of a crop was 1,000 koku (of rice) (a unit of volume: rice 1-koku is 180.39 liter, lumber 1-koku is 0.278 cubic meter) or over (Their yakudaka [salary paid in accordance with the rank of one's post] based on tashidaka system [a wage system established by the Edo bakufu] was 1,000 koku.).

sen.j: 中間管理職として小十人組頭（役高300俵）があった。
sen.e: The middle manager of Kojunin was Kojunin kumigashira (a group leader of escort guards) whose yakudaka was 300 bales of rice.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処/小十人組頭: Kojyunin kumigashira (a ganger of escort guard)と登録されていますが「ganger」はイギリス英語(英辞郎 on the Web)なので、「http://tangorin.com/words/組頭」の訳語を使用しています。
sen.e: The middle manager of Kojunin was Kojunin kumigashira (a group leader of escort guards) whose yakudaka was 300 bales of rice.

sen.j: 将軍外出予定地の実地調査のためにしばしば出張した。
sen.e: Kojunin kumigashira often traveled on official business to a shogun's destination to survey the site.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Kojunin kumigashira often traveled on official business to a shogun's destination to survey the site.

sen.j: 小十人頭（番頭）・組頭は馬上資格を持つ。
sen.e: Kojunin gashira (or Kojunin banto) and Kojunin kumigashira were entitled to ride on horseback.
sen.cmt: 馬上資格: 用語集の訳語は文構造に合わないため、修正しています。
sen.e: Kojunin gashira (or Kojunin banto) and Kojunin kumigashira were entitled to ride on horseback.
Kojunin gashira (or Kojunin banto) and Kojunin kumigashira were entitled to ride on horseback.

sen.j: 時代によって異なるが、江戸幕府には概ね小十人頭は20名、小十人組頭は40名、小十人番衆は400名がいた。
sen.e: There were generally 20 Kojunin gashira, 40 Kojunin kumigashira and 400 Kojunin banshu (guards holding the post of Kojunin) in the Edo bakufu, although each number differed from age to age.
sen.cmt: 小十人番衆: 定訳不明。「番衆」として用語集に登録されている訳語を基に、文脈に合う説明をカッコ内に記しています。
sen.e: There were generally 20 Kojunin gashira, 40 Kojunin kumigashira and 400 Kojunin banshu (guards holding the post of Kojunin) in the Edo bakufu, although each number differed from age to age.
There were generally 20 Kojunin gashira, 40 Kojunin kumigashira and 400 Kojunin banshu (guards holding the post of Kojunin) in the Edo bakufu, although each number differed from age to age.

sen.j: 小十人の番士は、旗本の身分を持つが、馬上資格がないという特徴がある。
sen.e: Banshi (a samurai serving as a guard in the Edo period) holding the post of Kojunin was characterized by having a status equivalent to that of hatamoto, but no entitlement to ride on horseback.
sen.cmt: 番士: 定訳は不明ですが、「http://kotobank.jp/word/%E7%95%AA%E5%A3%AB」の説明を基に訳しています。/旗本の身分: 後に「旗本に班を進める(昇進する)者もいた」という記述があり、小十人の番士は、旗本に相当する身分を与えられているが、両者は同じものではないと思われるため、そのような意味で訳しています。

sen.j: 小十人番衆は家禄100俵（石）級から任命されることが多かった。
sen.e: Kojunin banshu were often selected from those whose Karoku (hereditary stipend) was approximately 100 bales of rice (or koku).

sen.j: 小十人の役職に就任すると、原則として10人扶持の役料が付けられた。
sen.e: If one assumed office as Kojunin, yakuryo (executive allowance) corresponding to a salary for 10 persons was given to him in principle.

sen.j: 知行になおすと計120余石となる。
sen.e: The sum total will come to more than 120 koku in chigyo (the annual stipend).
sen.cmt: 知行: 用語集の訳語は文脈に合わないため、新和英中辞典第4版(研究社)の訳語を基にして訳しています。

sen.j: 江戸城に登城する際は、徒歩で雪駄履き・袴着用で、槍持ちと小者の計2名を従えた。
sen.e: When Kojunin went to Edo-jo Castle to work, he went on foot, put on Setta (Japanese traditional sandals) and hakama (pleated and divided skirt made in fine stripes), and had two servants, i. e. yarimochi (a lance bearer) and komono (a lower servant) with him.

sen.j: 江戸時代初期には、譜代席の御家人（御家人の上層部）の中で優秀な者・運の良い者（あるいはその惣領）は小十人となった。
sen.e: Distinguished or fortunate gokenin (immediate vassals of the shogunate in the Kamakura and Muromachi through Edo periods) among the high-ranking gokenin receiving Karoku (hereditary stipend) or their soryo (heir) were promoted to Kojunin.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処/譜代席の御家人: 定訳不明。用語集の「譜代席」の訳語は大名に関するものなので、文脈に合いません。「家禄がある御家人」(http://homepage2.nifty.com/kenkakusyoubai/zidai/hatamoto.htm)を意味するので、その意味で訳しています。「御家人」はここでは複数形なので、カッコ内の説明も複数形に直しています。
sen.e: Distinguished or fortunate gokenin (immediate vassals of the shogunate in the Kamakura and Muromachi through Edo periods) among the high-ranking gokenin receiving Karoku (hereditary stipend) or their soryo (heir) were promoted to Kojunin.

sen.j: 旗本に班を進める者もいた。

sen.e: Accordingly, very few gokenin were directly selected from those who guarded the route that a shogun took for Kojunin.

sen.j: 官庁会計・大奥をはじめとする役方（行政職・事務職）の役職に就任していた御家人（あるいはその惣領）が論功として小十人になることがあった。
sen.e: Some gokenin who had assumed yakukata (an administrative post or a clerical post) such as a governmental accountant or a post at O-oku (the inner halls of Edo-jo Castle where the wife of the Shogun and her servants resided) or their soryo were promoted to Kojunin thanks to a distribution of rewards according to their merits.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処/官庁会計: 用語集には「governmental accounting」と登録されていますが、ここでは役職名を指すため「…accountant」と修正しています。/大奥: 用語集の訳語のカッコ内の「Edo Castle」は「Edo-jo Castle」に修正し、動詞を過去形にしました。/役方: 用語集には「yakugata」と登録されていますが、「やくかた」(http://kotobank.jp/word/%E5%BD%B9%E6%96%B9)です。/論功: 用語集の訳語は合わないため、「論功行賞」のコメント欄の訳語を使用しています。

sen.j: なお、薩摩藩では天明に家格小姓与の品位を保つ目的で家格小十人組が置かれた。
sen.e: In Satsuma Domain, Kakaku Kojunin gumi (a group of guards whose Kakaku [family status] was Kojunin in Satsuma Domain) was formed in the Tenmei era to maintain the dignity of Kakaku Koshogumi (a group of guards whose Kakaku was Koshogumi [a family rank of lower-ranking samurais in Satsuma Domain]).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処//家格小姓与: 定訳不明。「小姓与(こしょうぐみ)」は、薩摩藩の下級武士の役職「(http://detail.chiebukuro.yahoo.co.jp/qa/question_detail/q1414054899?fr=rcmd_chie_detail)の「御小姓与」)およびその家格を指すようです。用語集には「御小姓与」で登録された訳語がありますが、「Okoshogumi」(Koshogumi)の説明がないため、上記サイトの内容を参考にして訳しています。/家格小十人組: 定訳不明
sen.e: In Satsuma Domain, Kakaku Kojunin gumi (a group of guards whose Kakaku [family status] was Kojunin in Satsuma Domain) was formed in the Tenmei era to maintain the dignity of Kakaku Koshogumi (a group of guards whose Kakaku was Koshogumi [a family rank of lower-ranking samurais in Satsuma Domain]).

sen.j: 小姓与の次男、三男で分家した者を編入していた。
sen.e: Those who were the second and the third sons of guards of Koshogumi and set up a branch family were admitted into Kakaku Kojunin gumi.

sen.j: だが、享和に廃止された。
sen.e: But Kakaku Kojunin gumi was abolished in the Kyowa era.
